title: Introduction to Czech Language and Culture
description: Lecture, five hours. Course 101A is recommended preparation for 101B, which is recommended preparation for 101C. Each course may be waived with consent of instructor. Beginning Czech language course with strong cultural component. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Introduction to Czech Language and Culture
description: Lecture, five hours. Course 101A is recommended preparation for 101B, which is recommended preparation for 101C. Each course may be waived with consent of instructor. Beginning Czech language course with strong cultural component. P/NP or letter grading.

description: Lecture, five hours. Recommended preparation: course 101A (may be waived with consent of instructor). Beginning Czech language course with strong cultural component. P/NP or letter grading.

description: Lecture, five hours. Recommended preparation: courses 101A, 101B (may be waived with consent of instructor). Beginning Czech language course with strong cultural component. P/NP or letter grading.

description: Lecture, five hours. Recommended preparation: courses 101A, 101B (may be waived with consent of instructor). Beginning Czech language course with strong cultural component. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: course 101C (may be waived with consent of instructor). Course 102A is recommended preparation for 102B, which is recommended preparation for 102C. Each course may be waived with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: course 101C (may be waived with consent of instructor). Course 102A is recommended preparation for 102B, which is recommended preparation for 102C. Each course may be waived with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: course 102A (may be waived with consent of instructor). P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: course 102A (may be waived with consent of instructor). P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: courses 102A, 102B (may be waived with consent of instructor). P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, three hours. Recommended preparation: courses 102A, 102B (may be waived with consent of instructor). P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intensive Elementary Czech
description: Lecture, 25 hours. Intensive basic course in Czech equivalent to courses 101A, 101B, 101C. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intensive Elementary Czech
description: Lecture, 25 hours. Intensive basic course in Czech equivalent to courses 101A, 101B, 101C. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intensive Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, 25 hours. Intensive advanced course in Czech equivalent to courses 102A, 102B, 102C. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intensive Advanced Czech
description: Lecture, 25 hours. Intensive advanced course in Czech equivalent to courses 102A, 102B, 102C. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Survey of Czech Literature from Middle Ages to Present
description: Lecture, three hours. Lectures and readings in English. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Survey of Czech Literature from Middle Ages to Present
description: Lecture, three hours. Lectures and readings in English. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Tutorial Instruction in Czech
description: Tutorial, one hour; laboratory, one hour. Enforced requisite: course 102C or Czech placement test. Tutorial and guided independent study of advanced Czech: advanced conversation, composition, vocabulary development, and review of selected grammar topics. May be repeated for credit with topic change. P/NP or letter grading.

May be repeated for credit with topic change. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.

title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars
description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.

title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars
description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.

title: Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower-division lecture course. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Student Research Program
description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower-division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.

title: Student Research Program
description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower-division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated.
